title.value: A Heat Diffusion Perspective on Geodesic Preserving Dimensionality Reduction
title.justification: The title is taken directly from the paper's title header.
title.quote: A Heat Diffusion Perspective on Geodesic Preserving Dimensionality Reduction

extractions.description: This paper introduces the Heat Geodesic Embedding method as a novel approach for dimensionality reduction, leveraging theoretical connections between heat diffusion and geodesic distances on manifolds. The method outperforms existing techniques in preserving the underlying manifold structure and cluster integrity in both synthetic and real-world datasets.

type.justification: The paper combines theoretical insights with empirical experiments to validate the proposed methods.
type.quote: We empirically demonstrate the advantages of Heat Geodesic Embedding in preserving manifold geodesic distances in several experiments showcasing more faithful manifold distances in the embedding space, as well as our ability to interpolate data within the manifold.

name.justification: The paper focuses on dimensionality reduction techniques using heat diffusion perspectives.
name.quote: We present a versatile geodesic-preserving method for dimensionality reduction which we call heat geodesic embedding.

name.quote: Diffusion-based manifold learning methods have proven useful in representation learning and dimensionality reduction.

name.justification: PHATE is mentioned and compared to the proposed method (Heat Geodesic Embedding).
name.quote: Furthermore, based on our understanding of other methods [21, 5], we introduce theoretically justified parameter choices that allow our method to have greater versatility in terms of distance denoising and emphasis on local versus global distances... We establish connections between our method and popular dimensionality reduction techniques such as PHATE and t-SNE, shedding light on their geodesic preservation and denoising properties based on modifications of the computed dissimilarity and distance preservation losses.

is_contributed.justification: PHATE is referenced as an existing method that is being compared against.
is_contributed.quote: Furthermore, based on our understanding of other methods [21, 5], we introduce theoretically justified parameter choices that allow our method to have greater versatility in terms of distance denoising and emphasis on local versus global distances.

is_executed.justification: PHATE is executed and compared in the experiments.
is_executed.quote: We also showcase our method on single cell RNA-sequencing datasets with both continuum and cluster structure, where our method enables interpolation of withheld timepoints of data. Finally, we show that parameters of our more general method can be configured to give results similar to PHATE (a state-of-the-art diffusion based manifold learning method) as well as SNE (an attraction/repulsion neighborhood based method that forms the basis of t-SNE).
